comments:
The exception below seems to be happening with any .lst file:

Message: NullPointerException thrown: null
Stack trace: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.aspectj.ajde.internal.CompilerAdapter.configureBuildOptions(CompilerAdapter.java:296)
	at
org.aspectj.ajde.internal.CompilerAdapter.genBuildConfig(CompilerAdapter.java:170)
	at org.aspectj.ajde.internal.CompilerAdapter.compile(CompilerAdapter.java:95)
	at
org.aspectj.ajde.internal.AspectJBuildManager$CompilerThread.run(AspectJBuildManager.java:191)

we have many tests in the suite that use lst files, and AJDT uses lst files to
drive the compiler too - could you give a few more details about the command
line or ant options you are using to kick off the compiler please? sounds like
you could easily create a small self-contained test to reproduce this? If so,
adding that as an attachment to this bug report would be very helpful.

thks, Adrian.

I followed the following steps:
1. Ran "java -jar aspectjtools.jar" 
2. Selected a build configuration and supplied a .lst file with one test class
in it.
3. Attempted to build a configuration. This step failed with AJDE error window
displaying the NPE.

Roman, this should be resolved now and I was able to successfully compile
typical .lst files with the browser.  If the browser still doesn't work
for you on the next release please reopen the report and post the first 
few lines of the .lst file that you are building.
